data_asset.label: Data Asset
data_asset.description: A data asset refers to any structured or unstructured data that holds value to an organization, including sensitive information, intellectual property, or operational data that requires protection.

business_asset.label: Business Asset
business_asset.description: A business asset represents critical IT resources, systems, or services that support organizational operations and require protection against cyber threats.

physical_asset.label: Physical Asset
physical_asset.description: Physical assets refer to tangible hardware devices and infrastructure components within an IT environment that require security monitoring and protection.

virtual_asset.label: Virtual Asset
virtual_asset.description: Virtual assets refer to digital resources such as cryptocurrencies, NFTs, or virtual infrastructure that require security monitoring and protection against cyber threats.

software_asset.label: Software Asset
software_asset.description: Software asset refers to any software application or system that is installed, used, or managed within an organization's IT infrastructure, including details such as version, license, and vulnerabilities.

network_asset.label: Network Asset
network_asset.description: Network asset refers to any device, system, or resource connected to a network that needs to be monitored and secured, including servers, workstations, and IoT devices.

cloud_asset.label: Cloud Asset
cloud_asset.description: A cloud asset represents any virtualized resource or service hosted in a cloud environment, including virtual machines, storage, and applications.
